title: Jesus' High Priestly Prayer
shortSummary: John 17 records Jesus' profound prayer to the Father just before His arrest, revealing His intimate relationship with God and His heart for His disciples and future believers. This chapter highlights themes of glorification, unity, sanctification, and eternal life, offering deep insight into Jesus' mission and intercession.
timeline: c. AD 30 - The night before Jesus' crucifixion

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who prays to the Father, interceding for Himself, His disciples, and all future believers.

keyCharacters.name: The Father
keyCharacters.description: God the Father, to whom Jesus directs His prayer, requesting glorification and protection for His followers.

keyCharacters.name: The Disciples
keyCharacters.description: The men given to Jesus by the Father, for whom Jesus prays for protection, unity, and sanctification.

definitions.definition: To honor, magnify, or reveal the divine nature and majesty of God or Christ.
To set apart as holy; to purify and make spiritually clean through truth.
The unending life that comes through knowing the only true God and Jesus Christ, characterized by a personal relationship with God.
A title referring to Judas Iscariot, the betrayer, meaning one doomed to destruction as foretold in Scripture.

outline.heading: Jesus Prays for Himself
outline.description: Jesus begins by asking the Father to glorify Him so that He may glorify the Father, affirming His divine authority and the completion of His earthly mission.

outline.heading: Jesus Prays for His Disciples
outline.description: Jesus intercedes specifically for His disciples, praying for their protection, unity, sanctification, and joy amid a hostile world.

outline.heading: Jesus Prays for All Believers
outline.description: Jesus extends His prayer to include all future believers, emphasizing unity in the body of Christ and the experience of divine love and glory.

application: Pray earnestly for unity among believers, reflecting the oneness Jesus prayed for in John 17.
Seek sanctification through God’s Word daily, allowing truth to purify and guide your life.
Trust Jesus’ intercession on your behalf, knowing He prays for your protection and spiritual growth.
Live boldly in the world without being conformed to it, maintaining a distinct Christian identity.

keyVerses.text: And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.
keyVerses.significance: Defines eternal life as knowing God personally through Jesus Christ, central to Christian faith.

keyVerses.text: And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we are.
keyVerses.significance: Jesus prays for the protection and unity of His disciples, modeling intercessory prayer.

keyVerses.text: Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the essential role of God’s Word in sanctifying believers.

keyVerses.text: That they all may be one; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.
keyVerses.significance: Emphasizes the unity of believers as a testimony to the world of Christ’s divine mission.
